text: Hi All, Using this blog API  <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/blogv2/put_blog_posts_blog_post_id> I am unable to update the blog post title
Can Any one help on this how to update the Title and outher data using PHP or node js
Hi guys! I am wondering in the CRM SEARCH(API), the Associations is only available in Deals and Ticket... why it's not available in other standard/object custom object?
Hi everybody :smile: I was wondering there's a way to send the data from a workflow with a specific json structure (Not the default one that starts with an id). This is for an integration with Emblue
so , select what you want to send instead of grab all of this stuff

Hey <@U017J1W2X8R>, there is not currently a way to do this with the webhook action, but it’s something that we might consider in the future. Out of curiosity, how would you expect something like this to work? Do you only want to choose which properties are included, or do you want to completely customize the payload to have a different JSON structure? And is there anything other than the payload/body that you’d want to customize?

In terms of workarounds, if you have operations pro, you could use the <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/use-custom-code-actions-in-workflows|custom code action> to make a request with a custom payload using a library like axios
different json structure. thank you very much

And another option, which doesn’t require operations pro but is a bit more complex, would be to use our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions|public API to create a custom workflow action>, and to use a `PRE_ACTION_EXECUTION` serverless function to customize the webhook payload (you can search in those docs for “Customizing the payload with functions”)
Hi Marcelo, I have removed your image as it contained a users information including email address. I would recommend removing users private data or blurring it out before posting images like this.
it was an example from HubSpot documentation haha
but thanks for caring about my company's security
can you point me to that page in question?
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-workflows>

Thanks for passing that on, it might be sample/placeholder info that JSON, I honestly didnt look at names or anything in the JSON just saw some code and what looked like Email and IP address info so yanked it down right away just in case :slightly_smiling_face:
ill do some checking on my end though. Thank you again :slightly_smiling_face:
Hi Prasad, I removed your image below this message as it looked to have contained API Key information in it. I would suggest rotating the API Key that was used in your call for that account.

Is it likely that the v3 version of the search API will always require an API Key/auth? It looks like I can use the API to search from just the frontend in the legacy v2 version but I obviously don't want to share my API key in the v3 version.

At this time we don’t have anything to say on it. The current state of the v3 API does require auth.
It’s possible that will change in the future to not require it.

We’re aware that this creates an annoying situation where you need to use a serverless function in order to use the v3 search API on the CMS.

Know that the v2 endpoint is not scheduled to be deprecated. We absolutely would announce ahead of time if we were to do so, and we likely would look toward finding a way to limit breaking changes with the default search module.

So you can feel safe continuing to use the V2 endpoint.
It`s happening since the morning, When I am trying to post records into Contacts through batch request It`s taking too long to respond, after inserting some of the records?

<@U7SL518D6> thanks for the info. I'll give it a shot. It seems like the cost of serverless functions on HubSpot is a bit prohibitive but I assume I can use any serverless function service. I'll have to look around...
If you don’t have CMS Hub Enterprise on your project then just use V2 as I suggested above. You can even use the default module we give you.
I have the module setup/working but I was trying to get some React (or maybe Vue) practice in
it's not all that clear to me why I can't just stuff React into one module with imported/exported files that all come together
I kind of want to try and just find out why it's a bad idea
